content:
• Tuesday, December 18, 2012
  • CECO

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CECO +17%. CSIQ +4%. APOG +4%. TEU +3%. KOG...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CECO +17%. CSIQ +4%. APOG +4%. TEU +3%. KOG +2%.
    After-hours top losers: SYMM -10%. MXWL -10%. IQNT -8%. APOL -5%. FANG -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • HNT

    Health Net (NYSE:HNT) lowers guidance, now seeing FY13 EPS in the range of $2.00 - $2.10, below...

    Health Net (NYSE:HNT) lowers guidance, now seeing FY13 EPS in the range of $2.00 - $2.10, below consensus estimates of $2.12. Revenue is expected to come in around $10.7B - $11.2B, with Street consensus at $12.08B. The company says the lower estimates are largely due to ongoing product and geographic mix shifts, plus higher overall costs. Shares -11% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • EGN

    Energen (NYSE:EGN) -2.8% AH after issuing downward guidance for FY 2012, seeing EPS of...

    Energen (NYSE:EGN) -2.8% AH after issuing downward guidance for FY 2012, seeing EPS of $3.15-$3.25 vs. $3.42 analyst consensus. Says its 2013 capital budget of $975M will focus primarily on the exploration and development of its liquids-rich assets in the Permian Basin, but infrastructure-related issues will negatively affect production in Q4 2012 and possibly H1 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • AIR

    AAR Corp. (NYSE:AIR): FQ2 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $512.8M (+6.4% Y/Y) misses by...

    AAR Corp. (NYSE:AIR): FQ2 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $512.8M (+6.4% Y/Y) misses by $32M. Shares +1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Coal stocks are outperforming following comments from the International Energy Agency, which...

    Coal stocks are outperforming following comments from the International Energy Agency, which said it expects coal to eclipse oil as world's top energy source around 2017. Among stocks posting solid gains: ANR +4.4%, ACI +3.2%, BTU +2.7%, CNX +1.8%, WLT +0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 3 Comments
  • ZGNX

    Zogenix (ZGNX +8.1%) moves up today after saying the FDA has scheduled two days of hearings...

    Zogenix (ZGNX +8.1%) moves up today after saying the FDA has scheduled two days of hearings February 7-8 after receiving "comments, petitions, and informal inquiries concerning the extent to which opioid drugs should be used in the treatment of pain." Last week A panel of non-FDA medical experts shot down ZGNX's Zohydro, a hydrocodone pill for chronic pain. Hydrocodone is a semi-synthetic opioid derived from either codeine or thebaine.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • CEI

    Lucas Energy (LEI -16.4%) says its $22M senior secured promissory note due to Nordic Oil...

    Lucas Energy (LEI -16.4%) says its $22M senior secured promissory note due to Nordic Oil USA I is past due, and Nordic has filed a lawsuit to seek repayment of the note and a judicial foreclosure of properties acquired from Nordic.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes' (BHI +2.8%) warning of lower Q4 North American revenue and profit margins wasn't...

    Baker Hughes' (BHI +2.8%) warning of lower Q4 North American revenue and profit margins wasn't as bad as some had expected, and shares have powered higher after early weakness; peers HAL +3.2% and SLB +1.8% also gain. Analysts are divided on BHI's guidance; Barclays sees the report as a buying opportunity, while other analysts cut their price targets to as low as $40.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • USCR

    U.S. Concrete (USCR +4.1%) says it's completed the sale of its wholly owned subsidiary, Smith...

    U.S. Concrete (USCR +4.1%) says it's completed the sale of its wholly owned subsidiary, Smith Precast, for $4.27M in cash to Jensen Enterprises. The company says proceeds from the sale will be used to repay debt under its revolving credit facility and create liquidity for earnings enhancing activities such as acquisitions and organic growth opportunities.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • LPNT

    JPMorgan initiates coverage of a few hospitals with an "overall constructive outlook." The firm...

    JPMorgan initiates coverage of a few hospitals with an "overall constructive outlook." The firm says that despite volatility amid the fiscal-cliff debate and the potential for delays in coverage expansion under the Affordable Care Act, multiyear benefits from that coverage expansion outweigh the uncertainty. The firm also sees "meaningful economic improvement" for the sector coming in 2014-2016. It calls LifePoint (LPNT +4.4%), Universal Health (UHS +3.4%) and HCA (HCA +1.7%) its favorite picks, while aso starting Tenet (THC +4%) and Community Health (CYH +3.5%) at Overweight.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • MM

    Even as many fret about mobile monetization, eMarketer is hiking its 2012 U.S. mobile ad sales...

    Even as many fret about mobile monetization, eMarketer is hiking its 2012 U.S. mobile ad sales forecast to $3.84B from a prior $2.61B. Also, its 2013 and 2014 forecasts now stand at $6.97B and $10.94B. That could be lifting Millennial Media (MM +5.7%), whose 2013 and 2014 estimates are now at $138M and $199M, and Pandora (P +4.3%), which is at $347M and $496M. Market leader Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) U.S. sales are now expected to total $2.17B in 2012, $3.98B in 2013, and $6.33B in 2014. For Facebook (NASDAQ:FB), the numbers are $339M, $851M, and $1.22B. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • SLGN

    Silgan Holdings (SLGN -3%) revises its EPS outlook for FY12, now expecting an EPS of around...

    Silgan Holdings (SLGN -3%) revises its EPS outlook for FY12, now expecting an EPS of around $2.65 - $2.75, down from its prior range estimate of between $2.80 - $2.85. For Q4, the company now expects to earn $0.43 - $0.53, also below the prior range of $0.58 - $0.63. Analysts were expecting an FY12 EPS of $2.82 and a Q4 EPS of $0.60. Separately, the company also extended its $250M stock buyback to February 5, 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • OREX

    Orexigen Therapeutics (OREX -2.6%) has completed the screening of new patients for its Light...

    Orexigen Therapeutics (OREX -2.6%) has completed the screening of new patients for its Light Study trial to evaluate its obesity drug Contrave. About 9K patients will be randomized in the study within the next few weeks. OREX anticipates resubmiting the Contrave New Drug Application and conducting the interim analysis in 2013, with potential approval as early as fourth quarter 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • AAPL

    After falling hard last week, Apple (AAPL +2.3%) is outperforming again today. Likely helping...

    After falling hard last week, Apple (AAPL +2.3%) is outperforming again today. Likely helping are positive notes from RBC and Wells Fargo, both of whom take kindly to Apple's initial Chinese iPhone 5 sales data. After digesting the data, Wells thinks a prior estimate for 46M FQ1 iPhone sales will be met or exceeded. However, the firm is worried about what it sees as "evolutionary versus revolutionary steps in innovation."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 14 Comments
  • APL

    Atlas Pipeline (APL +2.4%) is initiated at Outperform by Robert W. Baird, which notes APL is...

    Atlas Pipeline (APL +2.4%) is initiated at Outperform by Robert W. Baird, which notes APL is poised to harness notable tailwinds in 2013 and beyond as oil and gas production in its attractive footprint within the Permian, Anadarko and Ardmore basins continues to swell and significant new throughput capacity in development since mid-2011 begins to ramp.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • BOSC

    Midday top 10 gainers: BOSC +83%. OPXA +31%. MEIP +30%. ARB +24%. RNIN +21%. VNDA +21%. III...

    Midday top 10 gainers: BOSC +83%. OPXA +31%. MEIP +30%. ARB +24%. RNIN +21%. VNDA +21%. III +18%. NVGN +16%. SNFCA +14%. GDP +14%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: AWRE -23%. CNH -18%. LEI -17%. GALE -17%. LIVE -16%. CIS -14%. GTAT -13%. MNGA -12%. RCMT -12%. SWHC -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • GASS

    StealthGas (GASS +4%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $10 price target at Global Hunter,...

    StealthGas (GASS +4%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $10 price target at Global Hunter, which likes GASS' niche as an operator of small liquid petroleum gas vessels, which the firm thinks has an attractive supply/demand outlook. GASS' higher charter coverage and strong balance sheet should support continued fleet growth and modernization, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • TROX

    Tronox (TROX +9.3%) extends yesterday's 10% rally inspired by a positive article in Barron's,...

    Tronox (TROX +9.3%) extends yesterday's 10% rally inspired by a positive article in Barron's, which argued shares could double or even trouble as demand normalizes for titanium dioxide, a white pigment used in paints. TROX is getting picked up by the Street as a value play on the housing rebound; Tim Seymour calls TROX "ridiculously cheap" and says money managers are accumulating the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -2.6%) is sliding for the second day in a row (previous) after National...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -2.6%) is sliding for the second day in a row (previous) after National Bank issues a downgrade to Sector Perform. Shares are still up 90% from when RIM delivered its FQ2 beat, which was fueled by strong emerging markets sales. The big question going into Thursday's FQ3 report may be to what extent RIM has been able to hold its ground in emerging markets as cheap Android phones continue to proliferate.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • SEII

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT +3.2%) says it's appointed Adam Wasserman as its new chief financial...

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT +3.2%) says it's appointed Adam Wasserman as its new chief financial officer, effective on December 10. He will succeed Wanfen Xu, whose resignation will be effective on the same day.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • WWR

    Uranium Resources (URRE -13.5%) says it has filed a proxy statement to seek shareholder approval...

    Uranium Resources (URRE -13.5%) says it has filed a proxy statement to seek shareholder approval of a reverse stock split to regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum $1 bid price requirement. URRE also plans to undertake a shareholder rights offering in 2013, and says it closed $5M in bridge financing. Shares had jumped 24% yesterday on Japanese election results.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • INVA

    Theravance (THRX +2.4%) and GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +0.6%) have submitted a New Drug Application...

    Theravance (THRX +2.4%) and GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +0.6%) have submitted a New Drug Application for the investigational drug UMEC/VI (LAMA/LABA), named Anoro Ellipta, which is a potential treatment for patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. The companies also intend to file regulatory applications in the European Union as well as other countries in the coming year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • HEP

    Holly Energy Partners (HEP +4.9%) pushes higher after Alerian announces that HEP will be added...

    Holly Energy Partners (HEP +4.9%) pushes higher after Alerian announces that HEP will be added to the Alerian MLP Index (NYSEARCA:AMLP) beginning Dec. 21. Inergy (NRGY -3.6%) will be removed from the index at that time.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • UNIS

    Shares of medical device company Unilife (UNIS +6%) move up today after Cantor Fitzgerald...

    Shares of medical device company Unilife (UNIS +6%) move up today after Cantor Fitzgerald initiated coverage with a Buy on valuation with a price target of $7.50 a share. Cantor says the company's risk profile is looking very good, and with better clarity in regards to revenue and pipeline issues coming out of its recent annual meeting, the stock looks poised to gain.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 2 Comments
  • YOKU

    In addition to upgrading Ctrip, Macquarie has lifted its rating on Youku Tudou (YOKU +6.3%) by...

    In addition to upgrading Ctrip, Macquarie has lifted its rating on Youku Tudou (YOKU +6.3%) by two notches to Outperform. The firm says checks point to strong demand online video ads, sees ad rates rising 20%-30% next year, and thinks content costs are unlikely to move higher. Morgan Stanley launched coverage at Overweight on Friday on expectations of strong growth and future profitability.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • SSNLF

    A few Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) suppliers are outperforming after Judge Koh denied injunction requests...

    A few Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) suppliers are outperforming after Judge Koh denied injunction requests for every device Apple was seeking a ban on. PANL +4%. SIMG +2.7%. BRCM +3.1%. TQNT +2.3%. Of course, Cirrus Logic (CRUS +4.5%), which gets over 3/4 of its sales from Apple, is also having a nice day, adding to yesterday's rebound. Also: Samsung just unveiled the Galaxy Grand, an Android phone with a relatively low-res 5" OLED display.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • CRI

    Shares of Carter's (CRI +1.9%) take a turn higher after Citi lines up the stock as a top pick....

    Shares of Carter's (CRI +1.9%) take a turn higher after Citi lines up the stock as a top pick. The firm thinks the restructuring at Carter's will pay dividends in 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • FXE

    The already-approved (see Tepper) rate cut in Mario Draghi's back pocket may see the light of...

    The already-approved (see Tepper) rate cut in Mario Draghi's back pocket may see the light of day soon if the euro continues its run higher. Financial implosion may be off the table, but the EU economy remains in recession, and the euro just broke out to an 8-month high of $1.3210. FXE +0.35%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • SLS

    Galena Biopharma (GALE -18.7%) discloses the details of its unspecified secondary offering...

    Galena Biopharma (GALE -18.7%) discloses the details of its unspecified secondary offering announced late yesterday, saying it sold 15.2M units for gross proceeds of about $24.3M. The units - consisting of one share of stock and a warrant - priced at $1.60 each. The warrants entitle holders to purchase half a share at an exercise price of $1.90. The company intends to use the proceeds for clinical trials of its breast cancer treatment NeuVax and a trial of its Folate Binding Protein-E39. The company has a current float of around 67.6M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • EFC

    Ellington Financial (EFC +1.5%) gains as Thomas Lott points it out as a cheaper,...

    Ellington Financial (EFC +1.5%) gains as Thomas Lott points it out as a cheaper, better-performing alternative to many of its peers in the mREIT industry. The company is actually a partnership - a good thing, writes Lott, as it allows management investment flexibility not available to REITs. The CIO is former Kidder mortgage trader Mike Vranos, who recently picked up more shares, and now owns 12% of the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • CTRP

    Ctrip (CTRP +4.9%) is higher following an upgrade to Outperform from Macquarie: the firm thinks...

    Ctrip (CTRP +4.9%) is higher following an upgrade to Outperform from Macquarie: the firm thinks sales and earnings have bottomed, and that the Chinese online travel market will show strong growth in the coming years. Ctrip rallied after delivering a Q3 beat and decent Q4 guidance last month, but some have been concerned about share loss.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • AUQ

    AuRico Gold (AUQ -2.7%) is downgraded to Market Perform at BMO Capital, which says shares...

    AuRico Gold (AUQ -2.7%) is downgraded to Market Perform at BMO Capital, which says shares now trade at a premium to the firm's mid-tier gold stocks. The recent sale of Ocampo and the application of the proceeds to reduce debt and buy back shares de-risks the company profile, while increasing the importance of a successful ramp-up of Young-Davidson.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +5%) rallies after BofA/Merrill upgrades shares to Neutral. The firm has...

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +5%) rallies after BofA/Merrill upgrades shares to Neutral. The firm has already changed its mind on the Chinese baseband chipmaker more than once this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • HLSS

    Home Loan Servicing Solutions (NASDAQ:HLSS) commences a follow-on offering of 22M shares,...

    Home Loan Servicing Solutions (NASDAQ:HLSS) commences a follow-on offering of 22M shares, with the underwriters granted an option to purchase an additional 3.3M shares. HLSS will use the proceeds to purchase additional mortgage servicing rights. Shares +2.4% today, +38.2% since the March IPO. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • PKT

    Procera (PKT +5.9%) opens higher after announcing an unnamed tier-1 Middle Eastern cable...

    Procera (PKT +5.9%) opens higher after announcing an unnamed tier-1 Middle Eastern cable operator has placed an initial multi-million dollar order for its PL8920 deep packet inspection appliance - Procera's deals thus far have generally been with wireline/mobile telcos rather than pay-TV companies. A PL8920 deal involving a major U.S. telco (probably AT&T or Verizon) was announced in September.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • LVS

    Nomura weighs in on the fickle Macau gaming market, reporting month-to-date revenue is up an...

    Nomura weighs in on the fickle Macau gaming market, reporting month-to-date revenue is up an encouraging 15% Y/Y through December 16. The firm thinks a double-digit pace of VIP revenue growth could provide a psychological lift to Macau-related gaming firms such as Las Vegas Sands (LVS +0.2%), Wynn Resorts (WYNN +0.4%), and MGM Resorts.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 4 Comments
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced (GTAT) -15.3% after resuming trading. The company has guided for Q4 revenue of...

    GT Advanced (GTAT) -15.3% after resuming trading. The company has guided for Q4 revenue of $95M-$102M and EPS of -$0.05 to -$0.10, far below a consensus of $146.4M and $0.14. It's also establishing 2013 guidance for revenue of $500M-$600M and EPS of $0.25-$0.45, well below a consensus of $886M and $1.16. An $80M-$90M Q4 inventory write-down is also forecast, and GT expects to exit 2013 with $225M-$275M in cash The usual solar and LED equipment industry issues are blamed. VECO -1%. (PR) (Q3 warning)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 3 Comments

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures join the broad European run higher after President Obama...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures join the broad European run higher after President Obama offers concessions on tax hikes in talks to avert the fiscal cliff. On the assumption Congress wants to go home for Christmas, a deal could come within days. Or maybe not. The S&P benchmark is +0.2%. Arbitron surges 24% on news it's being bought by Nielsen, while Baker Hughes is -2.9% following an earnings warning. Later: NAHB Housing Market Index, Oracle earnings
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) +5.1% premarket, adding to yesterday's gains (I, II). CNET has published an...

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) +5.1% premarket, adding to yesterday's gains (I, II). CNET has published an interview with CEO Stephen Elop in which he says Nokia is "planning a lot of exciting things with Verizon." Verizon (NYSE:VZ) currently offers the mid-range Lumia 822, but the flagship Lumia 920 is for now an AT&T exclusive in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 12 Comments
  • NUE

    Nucor (NYSE:NUE) -1.5% premarket after issuing downside Q4 guidance, seeing EPS of $0.25-$0.30...

    Nucor (NYSE:NUE) -1.5% premarket after issuing downside Q4 guidance, seeing EPS of $0.25-$0.30 vs. $0.34 analyst consensus estimate. NUE blames the decrease on a smaller LIFO credit and lower steel mill margins. Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) also -1.5% after issuing guidance late yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • VNDA

    Premarket gainers: VNDA +26%. ARB +24%. NOK +5%.Losers: AWRE -24%. GALE -20%. GTAT -14%. RAS -6%.

    Premarket gainers: VNDA +26%. ARB +24%. NOK +5%.
    Losers: AWRE -24%. GALE -20%. GTAT -14%. RAS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • VNDA

    Vanda Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VNDA) surges 27% after saying that its tasimelteon drug for...

    Vanda Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VNDA) surges 27% after saying that its tasimelteon drug for treating non-24-hour disorder performed well in Phase III trials. Non-24 affects the majority of blind people who don't perceive light and so can't entrain (reset) their master body clock to the 24-hour day. They therefore sleep later and later, which is highly disruptive to their lives. From 65-95K people in the U.S. suffer from non-24.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • LUK-OLD

    More on Jefferies (NYSE:JEF) FQ4 earnings: Fixed income revenues more than double Y/Y to $293M....

    More on Jefferies (NYSE:JEF) FQ4 earnings: Fixed income revenues more than double Y/Y to $293M. Investment banking revenues of $283M, +8.3% Y/Y. Adjusted tangible book value of $14.24/share, up 9.5% Y/Y. Shares +4.2% premarket. Conference call begins at 9 ET. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • PVAC

    Penn Virginia (PVA) says it is seeking a new partner in its Lavaca County Eagle Ford Shale...

    Penn Virginia (PVA) says it is seeking a new partner in its Lavaca County Eagle Ford Shale acreage after its current 40% partner elects to go non-consent on the last 17 initial unit wells drilled or expected to be drilled. PVA -1.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • RBYCF

    Rubicon Minerals (RBY) -2.6% premarket on news it is facing legal action by the Wabauskang First...

    Rubicon Minerals (RBY) -2.6% premarket on news it is facing legal action by the Wabauskang First Nation relating to the company's flagship Phoenix gold project in Ontario. Phoenix is fully permitted to potential production, RBY says, but the company remains committed to further discussions.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • SSNLF

    Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) is reportedly withdrawing patent lawsuits against Apple in 5 EU countries....

    Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) is reportedly withdrawing patent lawsuits against Apple in 5 EU countries. Overnight in the U.S. case, a judge refused Samsung's bid for a retrial. AAPL +1.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 AM | 4 Comments

  • Asian and European shares are mostly higher as the two sides in the fiscal cliff negotiations in...

    Asian and European shares are mostly higher as the two sides in the fiscal cliff negotiations in the U.S. edge closer to a deal. Japan +1%, Hong Kong -0.1%, China +0.1%, India +0.6%. Euro Stoxx 50 +0.6%, London +0.3%, Paris +0.3%, Frankfurt +0.5%, Milan +0.7%, Madrid +0.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 AM
